thread.title: Study: These public, private Cobb schools are among Georgia's best
thread.title_full: Study: These public, private Cobb schools are among Georgia's best

author: Ben Brasch
title: Study: These public, private Cobb schools are among Georgia's best

organizations.name: mceachern high school etowah high school

text:
In what should come as a shock to few Cobbers , some of the county’s schools were recently named among the best in Georgia.
Cobb made it as high as the seventh spot in the ranking of Georgia’s 100 best public high schools by Niche, a school and neighborhood review website.
Niche analyzed data from more than two dozen sources — ranging from federal education agencies to FBI data to surveys of their own — to create the list. The group’s website breaks down its methods .
Cobb school to host Valentine’s dance for 800 special needs students
Here are the public schools the ranking recognized:
7th, Walton High School 12th, Kennesaw Mountain High School 18th, Lassiter High School 22nd, Hillgrove High School 28th, Pope High School 30th, Wheeler High School 35th, Harrison High School 52nd, North Cobb High School 56th, Marietta High School 78th, Kell High School 87th, Sprayberry High School 98th, McEachern High School Etowah High School was Cherokee County’s highest-ranked school at 39.
Of the 100 private schools analyzed , Cobb’s best held the 19th spot. The organiation explained how it ranked private schools, too .
Here are the private schools the ranking recognized:
19th, The Walker School 37th, The Whitefield Academy 40th, North Cobb Christian School 48th, Mount Paran Christian School 80th, Covenant Christian Ministries Academy 89th, Dominion Christian High School 99th, Cumberland Christian Academy You can find information about your school, such as test scores, graduation rates and school climate rating at the Ultimate Atlanta School Guide .
